comment: Robson is the best professor I've ever had. If you want to actually learn to get better, he is who to take. I've never been so inspired by a course or professor before in my years in school. He's a great guy, he wants you to do good, participate and ask questions and go to class everyday. NO ONES PERFECT. But you can be!!!

Professor Robson is VERY good at teaching painting, but I will say if you struggle to take critique this is not the professor for you. He is very hands on and wants to ensure that you are learning and assist you. He has a lot of homework at first, but it spreads out later on. By the end of this class you will paint well. Be ready to make canvases.

Seriously the best professor I've ever had. I took him for painting 1 and figure drawing. The workload is heavy, but he pushes his students to do the best they can. Gives the most useful critiques that have stuck with me and helped me improve my art. I recommend him, but would try and take "easier" classes along with his course.

He knows what he wants and it very strict. If you are sensitive you will not like how he teaches. However if you get to know his personality he isn't terrible. He is VERRY POSSIONATE about art and wants everyone to reach their fullest potential Has a big ego and Attendance is a huge deal to him. be prepared will all supplies. overall a good teacher
Good luck with the class if you are neurodivergent. He demands respect, is very strict/harsh, and is really blunt.

He gave a lot of homework at the beginning of the year that didn't feel helpful and took a lot of time. He kind of throws you in the water and makes you learn yourself, but he starts helping if you need it. I do feel like I learned and improved. Don't take him if you're sensitive he made a lot of people cry. Also you'll have to stand the whole time

Prof Robson is definitely a tough grader; he pushes you past your limits and encourages you to try new techniques and mediums. Take him if you really wanna learn figures well and play around with water color, chalk pastels, clay, and charcoal. Great professor who really cares about students giving them both compliments and feedback on their art.

Toughest professor I've had so far but I've learned more from him than any professor ever. He pushes you really hard and forces you to step out of your comfort zone. The stuff he teaches is really complicated and high-level. Be prepared for a lot of work in and out of class, but it's very worth it if you are serious about upping your skill level.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: You'll become a much better artist taking him. At the cost of him encouraging you to skip critiques and fail, brings up condescending conversations, rigs the grading system so you'll never know how he will grade you and will lower your grades, has poor time management/organization and will issue rushed deadlines when it was clearly avoidable.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Any class with him really teaches you about how subjective art is. I really value his input in terms of color and composition but if your subjects or style isn't what he likes, you'll need to change it. He gave good direction and feedback while you work but he doesn't really believe students will have work worthy of As so they're hard to earn

Professor Robsons class is one of the most demanding classes Ive taken, but also one of the most rewarding. Hes very straightforward and gave me good advice on how to make my paintings better. By the end of the class, I was a much more confident and competent painter. Also, hes a really cool and funny guy. Great to talk to outside of class.

Professor Robson is one of my favorite professors at Kennesaw State. His class is definitely one of the hardest and most demanding classes I have taken but if you apply yourself and put in all the work necessary you will no doubt come out of it a better artist. He pushes you to think outside your comfort zone and consider new materials.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I love Robson. Yes he pushes you out of your comfort zone but you learn SO much about painting and rendering in his painting class. He isn't there to pat you on the back and praise your art, he's there to help you get better and improve your work and pushes you to do so, which I like. He's actually a funny and nice guy once you get to know him.

Robson is relatively knowledgeable about art, however anything outside of his comfort zone is considered bad art. He seems to get bored with student artwork easily and gives lots of assignments, on top of assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you're looking for a class that makes you enjoy art, this isn't the class for you. Don is incredibly critical of artwork and his feedback is less than constructive. If you're looking for a class that really pushes you to think 10 steps out of your comfort zone, Donald Robson is the professor for you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: robson is one of the harshest professors ive ever taken. idek if i've ever heard him say something nice about any if my artwork. he doesn't care about his students and his this hypocritical back and forth feedback for his students that leaves them confused and discouraged.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If you want to paint like a hyperrealistic demigod, don't take him. He isn't interested in how detailed you can be by coloring in the lines. He wants you to work as big as you can, stretch your own canvases, and work quickly by moving from large gestures to smaller details. Also, don't come at him with pretty "instagram" paintings. He likes brown.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: he's nice i guess but the class is a joke. there's too much work and his grading is way too hard
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: MOSTLY for the painting and drawing. his class gives great inspiration for learning art and I am still very grateful after graduate..

Robson is a really great professor and he really pushes you to better your artistic ability and creativity. He is difficult especially for those of us who don't do fine art because the class deals a lot with that. I would highly recommend him for people who want to do fine art because he really helps you figure out ways to make things you do better
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Be ready for a lot of projects and don't miss any days of class. He doesn't let you email him and you won't know your grades and how you're doing until basically the end of the semester. Can be funny but also condescending. He bashes other professors which was off-putting. I find him to be discouraging instead of encouraging but he knows his stuff.

The best. If art is your life, take him. He gives so much work but he helps so much. Gives confusing advice but it stretches your mind and abilities. I have improved IMMENSELY in his classes. Hilarious and has shown me many types of artists. One of the few teachers that understands me completely and my art.

Get a backbone before you take him. He can run over you with his comments. You have to defend your own artwork at times but, he does this to make you mentally stronger. I definitely had to work to get a good grade. But my other class grades suffered because of the time i spent on these projects. I would take him again. My abilities improved so much
incredible teacher, i had him for drawing II and am currently taking him for life drawing. he can be an pain in the butt at times but its honestly just to push you to be the best artist you can be.

Best drawing 3 teacher. He is extremely difficult, but is extremely detailed and helpful. You WILL leave the class drawing the human figure better than you ever have before as long as you apply yourself. At times he will confuse you with the different advices he gives, he does that to expand your thinking. Dont slack off with him for any reason.

He is a very helpful professor. His class is not hard if you put the time into it. He grades fairly and gives valuable critiques. Pushes you to use and experiment different media until you are comfortable using everything. He is a bit rude at times, but nice guy overall.
He gives you a lot of homework assignments...but its really not that bad.  My drawing skills improved a lot after taking this class.  He's a nice teacher with an interesting sense of humor.

He is a great teacher and you will learn a lot.... especially when he shoves the info down your throat. Take good notes and listen to his advise. He doesn't always give compliments but acknowledges your effort. Give his methods a try and when he recommends something...do it!! You will leave his class in awhh. Remember patience and show up to class.

Robson is not the easiest teacher you will take but definately worth taking. He pushes you to do your best but watch out, not good on the compliments. There is a lot of homework and on going projects but you will have a variety of work that you will appreciate when the class is over. Take good notes and expect a B if you do the work! He's cute too!

I took Robson for Drawing I, Painting II, and Drawing III.  He loves assigning tons of homework and long-term projects.  Getting an A definitely requires you to go the extra mile.  He likes when people work large or be different than everyone else.  He likes loose and gestural work.  Overall, great professor and nice guy just be prepared to work.

DEFINITELY take Robson! He's helpful and pushes the people who try, but he can be mean to those he feels shouldn't be there. Go to class. He assigns a lot of homework but it slows down once you start working on the figure. Plus he's attractive and funny.

He's a great teacher. He expects alot but if you do the work and come to class you'll be fine. He's always willing to help you out. Communication with him outside of class wasnt very good but overall it was a very helpful class.

Don is an EXCELLENT professor. His Drawing III course is based off of human anatomy and is absolutely essential to take for any serious artist. He's extremely helpful, lenient in your process, knows his stuff, and makes the class enjoyable. Not an easy A, but definitely my favorite professor in this major.

He's VERY knowledgable and you can tell he enjoys the subject. I feel like I really improved my drawing skills from taking his class. Def. not an easy A-- just show interest and an effort and you should do well. Highly recommended if you love making art-- if you're not interested in working/improving, don't take him. He's hard work but I loved it!

At first he seems really hard, but really he just wants you to be better than "good enough". He's very helpful as long as you ask for it, because if you dont he just thinks you dont care. He has a strange sense of humor, so if you dont think he's making sense, then he's probably joking. Very cool guy once you get to know him
